data.title: Crowded, accommodating, but Fox News, give me a break
data.text: Fourteen of us had breakfast at the Diner and by and large it was ok but not exceptional in any way. The kids ordered pancakes and waffles that came with a mound of whipped cream on top. Most of them were happy with that. I ordered a corned beef omelet that would have been better if the corned beef had been sliced against the grain rather than with it - leaving the corned beef stringy and tougher than necessary. The hostess was very accommodating in finding space for a group as large as ours and the waitress was very good. FOX News on the TV didn't help my digestion.

data.title: Awesome, Huge "Short Stack" of Pancakes
data.text: We were staying at the nearby Sheraton for one night before heading to the east coast and we looking for an authentic, local spot for breakfast. We knew we hit the right spot when we saw the police cruiser out front. We were right on with our choice. To begin with, the "diner" (actually more of a regular restaurant in a strip mall conveniently located on a major road in an easily accessible location) was filled with locals (another good sign). The waitress was super-helpful suggesting to us that the better pancake deal was the so-called "short stack" because the pancakes (2 of them) were larger than the regular order and our coffee was included in the price. We ordered the blueberry pancakes and were shocked by their size. They were HUGE and filled with large, fresh blueberries. Although we gave it a valiant effort, we couldn't finish both of them. What a great, delicious deal accompanied by a friendly, helpful waitress for fair price. Overall, a winner!

data.title: Great great experience
data.text: Eva and young man helping her could not possibly be more gracious and efficient. We both had omelettes. Food and SERVICE WAS PERFECT!!!

data.title: Home Away From Home
data.text:
My wife and I retired about 18 months ago. We don't seem to eat at home much anymore. The Diner always has been a favorite, but now it's our home away from home; we'll, at least for breakfast (any time) or lunch.
 
I'm a pancakes or waffle man. She's and eggs and grits woman. The pancakes are so big I only order one; wheat preferably. She goes for the farmer's special.

She drinks coffee; says it's the best (next to the much-more-expensive Starbucks). Iced tea for me. The staff--very attentive and friendly--keep both coming. They know us now.

Sometimes it's for lunch. Their "off-the-bone" turkey (sandwich or plate) is delicious. The BLT is very good. Salads. Wraps. Burgers. The usual. All tasty.

We often see friends here, and it's always good to catch up.

This is not fine dining. But it's just fine with us. See y'all tomorrow!

data.title: BEST LOCAL DINER in PLANTATION
data.text: Great breakfasts, terrific lunches AND super, friendly service.  Need I say more?  Just let me add, the prices are reasonable and even during their busiest time on Sunday Morning - they work hard to get you seated and fed.   Locals LOVE it but if you're in town on vacation or business, try it out!  There is outdoor seating on nice days!

data.title: Most popular diner in Plantation
data.text: Popular and very busy for years, but it is run so efficiently that if there's a line, it's a very short wait.  Excellent breakfast or lunch (closes at 3 pm)  Wife of owner is a pastry chef who makes homemade desserts weekly.  Hot specials taste like they were made at home:  meatloaf, chicken salad and shrimp salad are favorites, turkey dinners with all the trimmings, fresh fish, etc.

data.title: Great Local Diner
data.text: Friendly staff in this old style, clean diner. The servers were wonderful and made sure we were happy. The food was perfect - simple, fresh and just what you want and expect from a diner. We loved it.

data.title: Delicious Breakfast!!
data.text: Nice and friendly neighborhood diner. Ramona was great! Food was excellent with very generous portions. Would definitely recommend!!!

data.title: real food
data.text: The place to go for good old comfort food, locals know that! You can have a copious breakfast and not get ruined.

data.title: Locals know best
data.text: Great place for breakfast or lunch. Have been here many times, never had a bad meal! Waitresses are friendly and work hard to make your meal enjoyable. Prices are good and portions are generous. Do not hesitate to dine here.

data.title: Early Lunch
data.text: Arrived early enough for breakfast (9:45 a.m.), but you can have lunch this early.  I had ate early before leaving the west coast of Florida.  I was able to order lunch.  I was not alone in an early lunch.  The apparently have lunch specials daily.  The food and service was top notch.  If in the area, I'll certainly add this place to my list.

data.title: High-end Diner:  Great service and delicious breakfast
data.text:
We were visiting Plantation for our niece's graduation from her "Physician Assistant" Masters program.    Only 5 or us were ready up and ready to do an 8 am breakfast.  My wife and I arrived early to enjoy a quiet cup of coffee and share one of their tender, moist, home-made biscuit.  That was a great way to start.  

Once the rest or our party arrived, we all ordered all of our personal favorites of eggs, sausage, pancakes, corned beef hash, hash brown potatoes, orange juice, etc.  Everyone was pleased with the service and the food.  

Our waitress provided great service and was patient as we waited for the rest of our group arrived.  

Recommended for breakfast or lunch!   Great place off the "beaten track".

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: Been going to the PD forever. Meals are always filling and tasty. Bacon is esp high quality. Prices are not low: if you are looking for an inexpensive meal this is not the place. But for a fair priced good solid breakfast or lunch you can't go wrong.

data.title: Late linch
data.text:
The food in this eatery is comfort food.always pretty good but not great.
     Service and prices are very good.
     The breakfast menu is varied and quite good.
    I reccomend this diner.

data.title: New York Style Diner
data.text: Love going for breakfast or lunch at least once a month. The food is delicious. Good portions. My favorite..corned beef hash, home fries and eggs over easy or the BLT. The staff is friendly.

data.title: Great breakfast, great prices, great service!
data.text: Had an early morning breakfast with our son and his wife before leaving for a cruise. There were lots of choices on the menu and the service was great. It was a very busy Sunday morning, but we were in and out very quickly. The food was delicious! This is definitely a great little restaurant!!

data.title: Yummmmmm
data.text: One of the best diners around.  Shrimp salad is fantastic.  Breakfast wonderful.  Very very busy but waitresses are excellent.  I go back a lot.  Great food!

data.title: Local Favorite
data.text: Good diner food. Always busy so expect a wait. Blackboard specials and large menu. Food always fresh. Wait staff warm and friendly.

data.title: wonderful local diner
data.text: The staff is "old school" plantation....very warm and they remember the regulars. The food came out exactly as ordered and was delicious. We ate breakfast and the pancakes are worth the calories

data.title: Great place to meet locals
data.text: the food is great, the service is awesome but be aware they are busy in the morning.  i suggest you be friendly/social as many who visit all know each other.  my wife and i only have been there for breakfast but have never been left unhappy.
